meanings.definition: The quality or state of being regressive.
meanings.sent1: The regressivity of the system made it difficult for progress to be made.
meanings.sent2: The regressivity of the tax policy disproportionately affected low-income families.
meanings.sent3: The regressivity of the situation was like trying to walk up a down escalator.
meanings.sent4: The regressivity of the trend was pulling us back into the past.
meanings.sent5: The regressivity of the policy was like swimming against a strong current.

meanings.definition: The tendency to regress or move backward in development or progress.
meanings.sent1: His regressivity was evident when he refused to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The company's regressivity led to a decline in innovation.
meanings.sent3: The regressivity of the project was like trying to turn back time.
meanings.sent4: The regressivity of his behavior was dragging the team down.
meanings.sent5: The regressivity of the decision was like hitting reverse on a moving car.
